  "triples": [
    {"s":"Wheatstone bridge", "p":"uses", "o":"two voltage dividers", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"The Wheatstone bridge is essentially two voltage dividers connected side by side."},
    {"s":"Wheatstone bridge", "p":"measures", "o":"output voltage V_out", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"The output voltage, V_out, is measured between the midpoints of these two dividers."},
    {"s":"Null mode", "p":"produces", "o":"zero output voltage V_out", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"If the ratios of the resistors are chosen so that R 1 over R 2 equals R 4 over R 3, the two dividers produce exactly the same voltage at their midpoints, and V_out is zero."},
    {"s":"Deflection mode", "p":"produces", "o":"nonzero V_out", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"This small change in R 3 produces a nonzero V

evidence: If the ratios of the resistors are chosen so that R 1 over R 2 equals R 4 over R 3, the two dividers produce exactly the same voltage at their midpoints, and V_out is zero.
